image.altText: Donald Trump stands looking down with a frown. Behind him large US flags hang behind pillars at the White House.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attempt to "make America wealthy again" by imposing tariffs put the world on the brink of a financial crisis. With a three-month pause ending within days, trade experts are warning the global economy could be plunged into turmoil.

title.children: Trump's tariffs put the world 'on the edge of a cliff'. Is he about to double down?

image.altText: A yellow flag that says "open home" flying off a yellow real estate sign advertising an auction.

props.synopsis: Cotality's monthly index shows national prices climbing to a fresh peak in June, as interest rate cuts drove a broad-based upswing across Australia's property markets.

title.children: 'Renewed momentum' as home values rise for fifth month

image.altText: Man wearing a suit and black jacket standing next to a wall.

props.synopsis: There have been more than 2,000 fatal overdoses in Australia for the 10th year in a row, according to a new analysis by the Penington Institute.

title.children: The 'huge' Aussie death toll that gets 'very little attention'

image.altText: us president donald trump and canada prime minister mark carney

props.synopsis: The Canadian government said "in anticipation" of a trade deal "Canada would rescind" the digital services tax, which would have hit US tech giants such as Amazon, Meta, Google and Apple.

title.children: US-Canada trade talks restart after Carney 'caves' on digital services tax

image.altText: A photo of Erin Patterson looking distressed.

props.synopsis: As a jury considers its verdicts in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial, here's a recap of some of the evidence put before them.

title.children: The evidence laid before the jury in Erin Patterson's trial

image.altText: Stormy clouds hang over newcastle's nobbys beach and lighthouse

props.synopsis: A "bomb cyclone" has now formed in the western Tasman Sea, and its intensification is showing signs of being even more explosive than initially forecast.

title.children: 'Bomb cyclone' confirmed for Sydney and NSW coast

image.altText: A tank rolling through a dusty field, kicking up lots of dust.

props.synopsis: Despite hopes of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the Israeli Defense Force stepped up its latest offensive in the Palestinian enclave on Monday.

title.children: At least 58 killed as Israel intensifies offensive in Gaza

image.altText: Woman wearing a black mask and sewing a pile of cargo pants.

props.synopsis: Bangladeshi garment suppliers say they are being pushed to the brink, forced to fire workers and repay bank loans of millions for clothes shipped to Australia but never paid for.

title.children: Failed retailer Mosaic's unpaid millions cause Bangladesh factory layoffs

image.altText: A man shirtless on a stage singing into a microphone.

props.synopsis: UK police have also launched a criminal investigation into both Bob Vylan and Irish rap band Kneecap's performances at the popular summer festival.

title.children: US revokes visas for Bob Vylan over 'death to IDF' chant at Glastonbury

image.altText: A photo of P Diddy at the Met Gala wearing a black and white stripped suit

props.synopsis: After seven gruelling weeks, Sean 'Diddy' Combs's trial is coming to an end. But there are still a few more developments to unfold.

title.children: The jury is deliberating on the fate of Sean 'Diddy' Combs. Here's a recap of the trial

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, two First Nations families are on parallel tracks, seeking justice for their teenage sons taken from them before their time. The boys should have been safe and protected — but weren't.

title.children: As two mothers mourn their sons, the silence of legislators speaks volumes

image.altText: Mamdani stands below a sign that reads 'afford to live, afford to dream'

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has called New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani "a pure communist" and threatened to slash federal funding to the city if the Democrat is elected.

title.children: Trump threatens to cut funding to New York if Mamdani doesn't 'behave'

image.altText: A man standing on stage presenting an electriv SUV to an audience.

props.synopsis: The founder of Chinese electric vehicle maker Xiaomi says he is "astonished" by the reaction from customers.

title.children: 'A miracle': China's EV newcomer sells nearly 300,000 SUVs in an hour

image.altText: Aerial shot of ship being towed out of port.

props.synopsis: Spirit of Tasmania IV has departed Scotland and is bound for Hobart, with its expected arrival announced as "late-August".

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV begins 27,000 km voyage to Hobart

image.altText: a woman who was injured during an arrest sit on a hospital bed talking to the camera with a patch over her eye

props.synopsis: The state's police force declared an investigation into Hannah Thomas's injury at a protest on Friday will now take place after designating the event a "critical incident".

title.children: 'Critical incident' declared after ex-Greens candidate injured during protest arrest

image.altText: A man wearing a white headband sweats profusely, with sweat dropping from his chin as he looks out of frame

props.synopsis: Temperatures in some parts of Western Europe exceed 46 degrees Celsius, with fires burning in two countries and respite from the heat not expected for at least a few days.

title.children: 'Remarkable' heatwave has authorities on alert across Europe

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Chris Bowen looking serious, wearing a black blazer and dark tie.

props.synopsis: The energy minister says new projects could not export everything they produce and need to offer at least something to the local market.

title.children: Energy minister says new gas projects need to sell locally

image.altText: An aerial artist rendering of a project

props.synopsis: Developers scrap a major green hydrogen export project in Gladstone, which was hailed as a pathway to helping achieve net zero emissions targets.

title.children: 'Sad day' as $14 billion green hydrogen export project axed

image.altText: A barbed wire fence pictured through trees against an orange sky

props.synopsis: At an inquest probing WA's first recorded death in youth detention, the Justice Department apologises for its failings "connected with Cleveland's death".

title.children: WA government apologises to family of first young person to die in detention

image.altText: A close-up picture of a netball net bulging with a ball inside it.

props.synopsis: An anonymous survey conducted by the players' association indicates just 12 per cent of Super Netball athletes feel comfortable raising concerns with the national sporting body.

title.children: Anonymous survey shows players still don't trust Netball Australia

image.altText: Various private health fund cards

props.synopsis: As Australians prepare to do their tax returns, some will be considering whether they want to take out private health insurance — if not for accessing the services, to avoid tax penalties in future years. So what should you consider?

title.children: Is private health insurance worth it? What to weigh up at tax time

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A working Sunshine Coast woman with dreams of owning a home says a new equity scheme excludes Queenslanders from secure housing.

title.children: Housing measures not enough to help woman with four jobs into own home

image.altText: smiling bald man holding dog

props.synopsis: Alexander Marinis, from Victoria, has been laid to rest and remembered as an intelligent and talented man. His identity puzzled Queensland detectives for more than a year after his body was found in the Maroochy River.

title.children: Man whose body was found in river identified after 14-month global search

image.altText: two plinths, one with a plaque and the other without.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police received a tip-off on Sunday that the stolen plaques had been dumped on Hobart's eastern shore in a hessian bag.

title.children: WWI memorial plaques stolen in Hobart found dumped

image.altText: Michael Voss walking across Adelaide Oval.

props.synopsis: Carlton president Rob Priestley says the club will make a "calm and rational" decision on who coaches the side beyond 2025 after a disappointing season.

title.children: Carlton boss declares Voss safe for 2025, won't guarantee anything beyond

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: The economic reform round table set down for August will talk about tax reform but a strategy for the future of artificial intelligence and robots should be part of the conversation.

title.children: Productivity and tax strategy can't ignore the impact of AI and robots

image.altText: A group of rugby league captains assemble before a trophy

props.synopsis: With two new teams joining the league, the NRLW has doubled in size in just over three years. Can the bigger competition be better?

title.children: Ahead of its biggest season yet, the NRLW is walking a fine balance

image.altText: Bupa

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest private health insurers has agreed to pay back tens of millions of dollars to thousands of members who had hospital claims incorrectly rejected.

title.children: 'We're deeply sorry': Bupa repays millions over incorrectly rejected claims

image.altText: people hold american flags in front of a fire truck

props.synopsis: A man who sparked a wildfire in north-western Idaho before fatally shooting two firefighters in a "total ambush" has been found dead at the scene with a gun nearby, authorities say.

title.children: Sole suspect behind Idaho sniper attack found dead after two firefighters killed

image.altText: ACT Treasurer Chris Steel

props.synopsis: Canberra residential ratepayers will now pay a $100 health levy, down from the $250 announced in last week's budget, after the ACT government was forced to negotiate with the Greens.

title.children: ACT health levy slashed to $100 as part of budget deal with Greens

image.altText: Woman stands in front of crowd with industrial action signs for nurses and midwives

props.synopsis: Negotiations are continuing after a push by the Queensland Nurses and Midwives Union for "nation-leading" wages.

title.children: Qld nurses prepared to ramp up industrial action in push for 'nation-leading' wages

image.altText: Close-up face shot of a young woman in a car.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering his partner during a camping trip to a remote cabin in 2021 admitted to initially lying to police, first responders and triple-zero call operators about her cause of death.

title.children: Man lied about partner's death after alleged camping murder, court told

image.altText: A pillow can be seen behind a rubble of bricks.

props.synopsis: Renters of an Albany property are looking for a new place to live after a stolen vehicle smashed into their house overnight.

title.children: Lucky escape for sleeping man as stolen car crashes into bedroom

image.altText: A hand holds up blocks that read 01 July. Stacks of paper sit below

props.synopsis: Minimum wage, parental leave and road fines will increase in changes to laws this new financial year.

title.children: New laws, changes and payments coming into effect this financial year
